intro: Eriostemon wonganensis, commonly known as the Wongan honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a rough texture with a distinct aroma. Eriostemon wonganensis is often found in rocky outcrops and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
